title: Framework Comparison and Selection
description: Comprehensive comparison of major cybersecurity frameworks, their strengths, overlaps, and guidance for selecting the most appropriate framework(s) for your organization.

sections.subtitle: Framework Objectives
NIST CSF vs ISO 27001
points: NIST CSF: Flexible, risk-based approach with five core functions
ISO 27001: Structured ISMS with certification option

sections.subtitle: MITRE ATT&CK vs Traditional Frameworks
points: MITRE: Focus on adversary behavior and TTPs

sections.subtitle: Common Implementation Patterns
points: ISO 27001 + NIST CSF for comprehensive coverage
CIS Controls + MITRE ATT&CK for technical focus
NIST CSF + COBIT for governance focus
Multiple frameworks with clear primary framework

quiz.title: Framework Selection Assessment
quiz.description: Test your understanding of framework comparison and selection

questions.question: Which combination of frameworks would be most appropriate for a small retail business that processes credit cards?
questions.explanation: PCI DSS is required for credit card processing, while CIS Controls provide practical, prioritized security controls suitable for smaller organizations.

questions.question: What is the key difference between NIST CSF and ISO 27001?
options: One is free and the other is paid
One is for small businesses only
ISO 27001 offers certification while NIST CSF is a voluntary framework
questions.explanation: While both frameworks address cybersecurity, ISO 27001 offers formal certification for organizations, while NIST CSF is a voluntary framework focused on risk management.

questions.question: When should an organization consider implementing multiple frameworks?
options: Never - one framework is always sufficient
When different frameworks serve complementary purposes
questions.explanation: Organizations should consider multiple frameworks when they serve complementary purposes, such as combining a risk-based framework with technical controls or industry-specific requirements.
